results.title: The Japanese press in action
results.brief_description: The busy world of newspaper production is surveyed. It briefly introduces the daily press of Japan and the role played by it in informing the public of news and comment from home and abroad.

results.title: The Japanese garden
results.creator_credit: DENTSU and Japan. National Tourist Organisation
results.brief_description: Atmospheric shots of misty valleys begin this stylised look at the natural beauties of the Japanese countryside and traditional gardens. Shows use of water and stone ornaments in formal gardens. Oriental music provides a complimentary background. No commentary.

results.title: The Janet Gardiner Case: Forensic Science at Work
results.brief_description: A dramatised film explaining, through the re-creation of a crime, the concept of forensic science and showing how the Forensic Section of the Police Department operates.

results.title: The Jamestown story
results.creator_credit: Document Associates, Philip S. Hobel, Douglas Leiterman and Karl Schiffman
results.brief_description: Focuses on Jamestown, a community with a history of strikes and labor troubles. Discusses an innovative program of labor management and co-operation that brought Jamestown back from the edge of economic disaster. Includes interviews with workers on the shop floor as well as managers.

results.title: The James Dean story: a different kind of motion picture
results.creator_credit: George W. George, Hughes Leisure Group and Robert Altman
results.brief_description: This is a special documentary movie on the life of one of Hollywood’s greatest legends - as told by his relatives, friends and fellow actors. The presence of James Dean in this film has been made possible by the use of existing motion picture material, tape recordings of his voice and by means of dynamic exploration of still photographs.

results.creator_credit_for_label: George W. George, Hughes Leisure Group and Robert Altman

results.title: The James Dean collector's classic
results.creator_credit: Thirtieth Cemalux and Hollywood House Video
results.brief_description: This is a tribute to one of Hollywood’s most remembered and highly acclaimed actors whose life and career was unfortunately cut short by a tragic car accident. James (or Jimmy) Dean was born in Marion, Indiana in 1931 and died only 24 years later on 30 September 1955. During his short acting career he became a cult hero for the youth of the 50’s, a rebel and an individualist whose sensitive and intense portrayals, particularly in “East of Eden” (1955, dir. Elia Kazan) and “Rebel without a cause” (1955, dir. Nicholas Ray) shot him to legend status almost overnight. Modelling himself on his heroes Marlon Brando and Montgomery Clift, James Dean managed to achieve his own heroic status as a Hollywood star proving that he too could be a great actor in his own right as witnessed in his role in his third feature film, the epic “Giant” (dir. George Stevens), where he starred alongside Elizabeth Taylor, Rock Hudson, Dennis Hopper and Carol Baker. This special Collector’s Classic contains some rare archival newsreel footage, stills, film excerpts from his three feature films, biographical details with personal narratives from friends and actors including Carol Baker, Dennis Hopper, Jack Larson, Natalie Wood among others, career highlights including footage of many of his bit parts in film and television, and finally a complete and uncut version of “The Unlighted road” (1951) which featured in the television series “Schlitz Playhouse of Stars. Backed by the music of Don McLean and “American Pie”, and some wonderful images of the “strange and different…but pure gold” James Dean, this is a most interesting and informative video. NOTE: Due to the unique material contained in this video, fluctuations may occur in picture and sound quality during the program.

results.title: The Jackson years: towards civil war
results.creator_credit: Dennis Azzarella and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Concentrates on Andrew Jackson’s first four year term. Covers his quarrel with the National Banks; the treaties with the Cherokees which saw the setting-up of reservasions west of the Mississippi; his resolution of the South Carolina dispute with the Federal Government; and the gagging of John Q Adams on the subject of slavery.

results.title: The Jackson years: the new Americans
results.creator_credit: Dennis Azzarella and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Looks at Andrew Jackson’s life prior to his election to the US presidency in 1828. Uses Alexis de Tocqueville’s book, ‘Democracy in America’ and a stage play to highlight aspects of Jackson’s life, such as his duel with Dickenson; his days in the militia; and his eventual election as president.
